Very impressive. I am a huge fan of both planes and they look very accurate. They might even be stealth, to the kerbal's radar of course.

Why do you keep reposting your planes (mostly these two) literally EVERYWHERE, new threads and random threads alike. Not hating on the crafts (they are EXTREMELY good), just saying you can probably hold off on the show and tell for a while

Why do you keep reposting your planes

Well, i reposted only F-22 because there was just one response (started thread about 10-12 days ago) I thought that thread sinked because a lot of other threads appeared.

(mostly these two)

F-35 was created about 1h ago.

literally EVERYWHERE

I'm making new thread if I design something new.

I'm also adding it to Zokesia Skunkworks! because I'm building for them.

If it's replica, then also to [showcase] Replica Craft thread! and updating my AIRCRAFTS & CARS Replicas thread

That's all. I don't see any 'random' thread.

You actually do make a new thread for each craft, but you also include all 201023 of your crafts aswell, and any chance you get you post them in diffrent megathreads as soon as possible..

I'm making new thread with craft but I'm also including all "201023" crafts?

When I did that?

Do you know how forum works?

If there is a thread on page "201023" and someone make a comment, then this thread is moving to 1st page. So you talking about my AIRCRAFTS & CARS Replicas thread probably, which contains "201023" crafts...

Yes, I'm adding my crafts to megathreads, but to appropriate ones.

Why I'm adding them to megathreads and making new threads?

I'm making simple crafts, so Separate thread gain 10 comments or less and die.

Megathreads live all the time, but not so much people notice new crafts, so it's gaining less recipients than Separate thread.

Separate thread got more views, but dies fast. Megathread live longer, so 6 months later, some people will read old posts from still living megathread and will see my posts, but they won't find separate threads.

Simple? If you don't agree with me, then hit "report post".

I'm creating crafts for people, to allow them to play with my crafts. I want to make the broadest possible audience without spaming in "random threads" as you said, so I'm posting my crafts to megathreads as long as they are appropriate ones

Before i say anything else im not hating on your crafts, they are really well made and look gorgeous, but there isn't a need to post a single craft in over 5 - 7 diffrent threads. Also if i may, would you attempt a pak-fa t-50? Absolutely love that plane and would like to see a stock one
Man that's a lot of fiddly bits on those wings. How much hair did you pull out making them?

10/10 I absolutely love these aircrafts. They are EXTREMELY -breaks apart when turning- maneuverable jets! I have been wondering, how did you get the winglets to stick onto your delta wing? Thanks, and awesome creations!

~Nerfnerf123

Breaks apart? It never broke apart at turns. ( x1 speed of course)

Maybe you got FAR installed. I never tried this plane with these mods

Thanks!

Man that's a lot of fiddly bits on those wings. How much hair did you pull out making them?

Yeah, i spent some time making them ;D I can't say how much. They are my second versions of planes, so I was working a bit faster than before
Mareczex your crafts keep amazing me! We at Zokesia are proud to have someone like you. Well done and keep up the good work! I will never get to your level of course.

I'm happy with that

It's not true ;d you just need to practise.

I got experiance with building because I wanted to recreate planes with just stock parts. I had (i still have) goal, to make them look as real, as I can.

First thing I learned by watching one video is that I can rotate parts more precisly with hoding "SHIFT"

With this knowledge I started to create replica planes: Su-47, Sr-71, one Boeing airliner, Concorde

It started to gets harder to recreate small crafts. Even if wing shape looked good, then rest of body looked awfull.

I learned about sticking tail connector to side of body (adding there intakes air).

Then i saw this:

It's K-16 by 9t3ndo

I learned, that i can use wings, to make plane look smoother and it made me to recreate crafts more presisly

I made my experiance not just by building, but watching other crafts and drawing conclusions, so I could learn more about building techiques. I had problems with performance. It was pitching down, it wasn't taking off etc... I learned about cliping wing surfaces inside plane, to make plane fly straight. Later I noticed that I can improve maneuverablity with "control" ones.

Building that took me some time (one month ago I discovered "allow cliping parts in editor" option in debug menu xD), but I clip it tradionaly. Pressins W and S buttons alternately

So if you want to improve, then set a goal and try to reach it

Edited February 23, 2014 by Mareczex333
